simpleUIApp

Class AIPlayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • simpleUIApp.AIPlayer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, Player

    public class AIPlayer
extends java.lang.Object
implements Player, java.io.Serializable
    Class used to represent Artificial intelligence It is possible to launch a game between 2 AI.
    Author:
    Laura
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AIPlayer(java.lang.String name, java.awt.Color color)
      Basic constructor,

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void action()
      action launches an attack from AI, pretty randomly
      java.awt.Color getColor()
      getter for the color
      java.lang.String getName()
      getter for the name
      void init()
      init actually initializes the AIPlayers attributes AITargets and AIPlanets, AITargets = possible targets for AI (can shoot its own planet), AIPlanets= planets owned by AI, putting ennemies/neutral planets twice in AITargets, just so the AI doesn't shoot at its own planets too much
      boolean isHuman()
      checks whether a player is a HumanPlayer
      boolean isLoser()
      isLoser tests whether AI has lost the game
      boolean isNeutral()
      checks whether a player is neutral (only used for the neutral planets at the beginning)
      void loose(simpleUIApp.Planet p)
      loose is called when one of AI planet's is conquered by the other player, it removes this planet from the owned-planets list and adding it to the targets list
      void win(simpleUIApp.Planet p)
      win is called when AI conquers a planet

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

        public boolean isHuman()

        checks whether a player is a HumanPlayer
        Specified by:
        isHuman in interface Player
        Returns:
        true if Human, false if AI

      • init

        public void init()
        init actually initializes the AIPlayers attributes AITargets and AIPlanets, AITargets = possible targets for AI (can shoot its own planet), AIPlanets= planets owned by AI, putting ennemies/neutral planets twice in AITargets, just so the AI doesn't shoot at its own planets too much

      • loose

        public void loose(simpleUIApp.Planet p)
        loose is called when one of AI planet's is conquered by the other player, it removes this planet from the owned-planets list and adding it to the targets list
        Parameters:
        p - - the planet conquered by the other player

      • win

        public void win(simpleUIApp.Planet p)
        win is called when AI conquers a planet
        Parameters:
        p - - the planet conquered by AI

      • action

        public void action()
        action launches an attack from AI, pretty randomly

      • isLoser

        public boolean isLoser()
        isLoser tests whether AI has lost the game
        Returns:
        true if AI lost, false else
